reviews.author: Amy Thomasson

reviews.text: A sensitive film that doesn't fall into triteness. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Denise Pieniazek

reviews.text: You end up with a very safe and conventional biopic that aims more at being a crowd-pleaser than an in-depth character exploration.
reviews.author: Keith Garlington

reviews.text: Queen was a group that broke down the rules for what a single or an album could be, and they deserved a movie that broke down the same barriers for movies, not this toothless wonder.
reviews.author: Tom O'Brien

reviews.text: Rami Malek is brazenly resplendent in the role, summoning Mercury’s high-energy performance antics as well as his mournful, introspective side.
reviews.author: Merryn Johns

reviews.author: Alessa Dominguez

reviews.text: Like many biopics, it's a bit glossy when it comes to the darker moments in (Freddie Mercury's) life. but the affection for the music and the great man is absolutely there..
reviews.author: Victoria Luxford

reviews.text: Bohemian Rhapsody alternates between an exceedingly bland dramatic shorthand about Queen and Mercury's life, and several long concert scenes that cannot help but enthuse the viewer.
reviews.author: Brian Eggert

reviews.text: I think this movie does [Freddie Mercury] so much justice.
reviews.author: Lonita Cook

reviews.text: Episode 16: The Age of Innocence
reviews.author: Taylor Baker

reviews.text: If the surviving band members had gotten out of the way, there could have been a movie that pushed boundaries the way the band did.
reviews.author: Kip Mooney

reviews.text: If you are a Queen fan, I think there's a lot to enjoy in this movie, because the performance scenes are absolutely fantastic.
reviews.author: Nicholas Oon

reviews.text: A black green cloud of bad stuff snorted up its own fat bottom. Freddie deserved better.
reviews.author: Jason Adams

reviews.text: The film squandered its opportunity to tell a story worthy of Freddie Mercury. He was magnificent and larger-than-life, and all we got is a plateful of mediocre and average.
reviews.author: Natasha Alvar

reviews.text: Bohemian Rhapsody tells the dramatised history of the influential British rock band, Queen, with the limelight focused firmly on the late frontman, Freddie Mercury.
reviews.author: Alix Turner

reviews.text: So forceful and enthusiastic that it's hard not to get caught up in the momentum and the impact of one of the most enduring groups in rock history.
reviews.author: Mike Massie

reviews.text: The high wire work of Malek and the thrilling concerts sequences will make you fall in love with Queen all over again. While far from perfect, Bohemian Rhapsody was a blast.
reviews.author: Dan Buffa

reviews.text: Thanks to the film's aesthetically pleasing musical sequences and Rami Malek's commanding leading performance, it still serves as an adequate reminder of both the band's musical genius and Freddie's one of a kind stage presence.
reviews.author: Matthew St. Clair

reviews.text: The film never really strikes an original note, choosing instead to tap into all the biopic high notes.
reviews.author: Richard Propes

reviews.text: Rami Malek is the movie and the only reason why it stands out, not much beyond his acting. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Victor Pineyro

reviews.text: The film clearly has its flaws, rolling out more like a "Greatest Hits" compilation than a creative concept album, but the experience is so nostalgically infectious as to be irresistible. Forget the mixed reviews; they're just radio gaga.
reviews.author: Jason Fraley

reviews.text: More bubblegum pop than gritty heartbreaking drama, Bohemian Rhapsody may have a few flaws but it is, without a doubt, made for its hardcore fan base. It's engaging, foot-tapping and one all-around rocking respectful party.
reviews.author: Zehra Phelan

reviews.text: The film is either scared of alienating its audience or can't bring itself to paint Mercury in a light that isn't totally mainstream, but either way, it's shallow.
reviews.author: Matt Cipolla

reviews.text: Mercury's deeply flawed personality is brilliantly brought out in all its contradictions by Malek.
reviews.author: Saibal Chatterjee

reviews.text: Bohemian Rhapsody was made to pay tribute to Freddie, not to explore his personal life. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Ricardo Gallegos

reviews.text: There are a great number of problems with Bohemian Rhapsody, but the passion for and behind the band is front and center, and that occasionally makes it a great deal of fun.
reviews.author: Steven Prokopy

reviews.author: Yasser Medina

reviews.author: David Lamble

reviews.text: Overall, this is nothing new. Neither good nor bad, but if you approach it from the right angle, it's a lot of fun.
reviews.author: Dan Scully

reviews.text: The film ends on a musical high, accurately capturing the essence of the band's energy but, despite Malek's best efforts, fails to capture the elusiveness of Freddie Mercury.
reviews.author: Marissa De La Cerda

reviews.text: Bohemian Rhapsody dives into the struggles that Freddie Mercury went through. Whether you are a Queen fan or not, it makes for a great drama (with awesome music!).
reviews.author: Tessa Smith

reviews.author: Chris McCoy

reviews.text: podcast review

reviews.author: Grethe Kemp

reviews.text: Freddie Mercury was a brilliant musician who left an everlasting mark on the world. Bohemian Rhapsody offers a small insight into Freddie's world and that of the band Queen.

reviews.text: It may be a watered down tale of one of the most 'mercurial' lives lived on earth, but it is also a beautiful tribute to the life lived only for performance.

reviews.author: Patrick Holland

reviews.author: Jason Escamilla

reviews.author: Kaitlyn Booth

reviews.text: It ends on a high note in every sense of the word, and by the end, you really don't want it to stop now.
reviews.author: Deirdre Molumby

reviews.author: Wesley Lovell

reviews.text: If the rhapsodic moments blow in and out of the narrative, they don't prevent Bohemian Rhapsody from being entertaining.
reviews.author: Wendy Shreve

reviews.text: I love this movie. This is the kind of film you go with friends who love Queen's music as much as you do.
reviews.author: S. Indra Sathiabalan

reviews.author: Sameen Amer

reviews.text: An authentic homage to Freddie Mercury. [Full Review in Spanish]

reviews.author: A.S. Hamrah

reviews.author: Kate Stables

reviews.text: Decent and watchable, without being nearly as resonant as it should be.

reviews.author: Sarah Ward

reviews.author: Pete Vonder Haar

reviews.text: An ahistorial jam session where everything is off cue.
reviews.author: Evan Dossey

reviews.text: Probably 'A Star is Born' will collect more awards, but as far as memorable music and great musical performances, nothing I've seen this year comes close to 'Bohemian Rhapsody.'
reviews.author: Robert Roten

reviews.text: Bohemian Rhapsody is one of those films that will either make you ecstatic or thoroughly annoyed. For me it's a joy. Yet I do get the annoyance.
reviews.author: Sherin Nicole

reviews.author: Keva York

reviews.text: It's a shame that such a didactic script and the attachment of Brian Singer taints what could have been a genuine and touching story.
reviews.author: Emma Davey

reviews.text: Under performing Queen biopic.
reviews.author: Dennis Schwartz

reviews.text: This one is an all-around crowd pleaser made for fans that, much like Mercury himself, succeeds despite its flaws.
reviews.author: Louisa Moore

reviews.text: The film's approach may not be especially deep, but it's undeniably entertaining.
reviews.author: Matt Brunson

reviews.text: that most conventional of biopics, the kind that moves smoothly and efficiently from one greatest hits moment to the next-in this case, literally, as many of the film's narrative shifts pivot on the creation of one of Queen's hits

reviews.text: A biopicture that is all about the music of Queen and lead singer Freddie Mercury.
reviews.author: Frederic and Mary Ann Brussat

reviews.text: The film boasts a wonderful lead performance from Rami Malek, but its clichéd narrative and sloppy, safe storytelling let down the larger-than-life figure at its center.

reviews.text: It's a bog-standard rise-and-fall-and-rise music biopic, and whatever affection has attached to it is pretty much the work of Rami Malek.

reviews.text: Rami Malek's portrayal of Mercury should garner well-deserved awards acclaim. Undoubtedly, it was one of the most enjoyable biopics I've ever watched.
reviews.author: Colby Bryant

reviews.text: Malek's portrayal is not an impersonation, but an electric homage to a man who he knew never could, or should, be duplicated.
reviews.author: Di Golding

reviews.text: The film seems more interested in selling Queen albums to a new generation than it is depicting the complexities of the men who helped to change the face of rock music.

reviews.text: Bohemian Rhapsody isn't the great movie it might have been. It's too sanitized, too safe. But thanks to an incredible lead performance from Malek ... it's still a pretty good time.

reviews.author: Tomas Trussow

reviews.author: Tim Stevens

reviews.text: One of the most frustrating movies I have seen in years, Rhapsody seems bound and determined to trip over its own feet at every turn. And yet, the music and one good-if-not-great performance keep it upright, though just barely.
reviews.author: Brian Gill

reviews.text: I came away thinking, "this could have been so much more," but I don't quite know how. I really didn't want a movie that solely focused on Mercury's tragedies. Malek's knockout performance is reason enough to see this.
reviews.author: Michelle Alexandria

reviews.text: Wrong, ugly and sad in so many ways.
reviews.author: Bob Grimm

reviews.text: Despite all the problems and rumoured on-set arguments, the good news is that Bohemian Rhapsody still provides comedy, tragedy and a killer soundtrack.

reviews.text: There's a lot to like, namely Rami Malek, who is essentially Freddie Mercury reincarnated... but overall, it was far too safe for my taste.
reviews.author: Chris Stuckmann

reviews.text: Bohemian Rhapsody -- a biography, a musical, a history -- succeeds on all fronts whether Freddie Mercury is an unfamiliar face or the object of long fandom.

reviews.text: All these disturbances decidedly took a toll on the finished product. All-in-all, Rami Malek's superlative performance keeps you riveted throughout...

reviews.text: Little more than a collection of sequences built around the performance of Queen songs, occasionally with some mediocre attempts to contextualise those songs.
reviews.author: Tim Brayton

reviews.text: Despite some fairly wild deviations from the true stories, Bohemian Rhapsody is still an intensely satisfying movie led by a fearless performance from Rami Malek.

reviews.author: Rahul Desai

reviews.text: A fitting tribute to Freddie Mercury and Queen, Bohamian Rhapsody is a stirring spectacle.

reviews.text: The movie itself isn't killer, but the music is worthwhile.

reviews.text: It's a crowd pleaser in the ultimate sense - building to a rousing final act that will leave audiences tapping their feet and humming along.

reviews.text: They told the story very well, it moved and it certainly wasn't boring. As far as entertainment goes...yes, all the yeses.

reviews.text: I really liked the film, but they did miss the boat on really giving this to the community that this should be for.

reviews.text: I liked that they didn't try to sugar-coat...if you want to be listening to this soundtrack for the end of time, spend your coins on this and go see it in theaters.
reviews.author: Sharronda Williams

reviews.text: Even if you hadn't ever seen Freddie Mercury speak or move, Malek seems to embody him through and through and crafts a performance that does justice to the legend and the man himself.
reviews.author: Damian Levy

reviews.text: Do not miss Bohemian Rhapsody and hopefully you can watch it again. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: William Venegas

reviews.text: Bohemian Rhapsody fancies itself like the song, ranging a gambit of genres at an inexplicable fashion and expecting its audience to love the certain absurdity of it all.
reviews.author: Matt Ward

reviews.text: I wasn't alive when Queen reigned supreme, but seeing Bohemian Rhapsody in theaters was the next best thing. This is a film for the optimists, the music lovers, and the champions of the world.
reviews.author: Morgan Rojas

reviews.text: Singer's take on Mercury's tumultuous life is glossy and superficial but the film's strength lies in its portrayal of Mercury's, and the band's talent.
reviews.author: Anne Brodie

reviews.text: As a longtime Queen fan, I felt an ache in my chest for Mercury and his memory. More than Queen faithfuls, the one-of-a-kind talent deserved a blue-chip biopic. Sadly, Bohemian Rhapsody isn't it.
reviews.author: AJ Caulfield

reviews.text: Find the theater with the biggest screen with the best sound to enjoy this epic musical. [Full Review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Diego Batlle

reviews.text: You leave the cinema knowing you've been had, but still feeling uplifted.
reviews.author: John McDonald

reviews.text: The long-awaited, much-feared biopic of Queen lead singer Freddie Mercury turns out, thankfully, to be a respectable and respectful tribute to glam rock's most flamboyant ambassador...Rami Malek carries the film with aplomb.
reviews.author: Jim Schembri

reviews.text: Wildly uneven, BOHEMIAN RHAPSODY is still very entertaining. Excellent performances by stars Lee, Hardy, Mazzello, Boynton and an Oscar nom worthy Rami Malek moors the clunky script and reminds us of the magnificence that was Freddie Mercury.
reviews.author: Diva Velez

reviews.text: With Bohemian Rhapsody, what we have here is a dumb and obvious film that features a number of strong performances and Queen's astounding music. It's a highly entertaining bad movie that often works in spite of itself.
reviews.author: Tim Brennan

reviews.text: An Oscar-worthy performance stuck in a mediocre script, basically a great Freddie Mercury impersonator lip-syncing Queen's greatest hits for 2 hours. Entertaining but hollow.
reviews.author: Tim Martain

reviews.text: The sort of watered-down pablum that should be embarrassed to show its face in a world where Walk Hard: The Dewey Cox Story exists.
reviews.author: Eric D. Snider

reviews.text: [It's] possible I hated this overblown mess of a musical biopic something fierce, and I'd rather not say another word about it.
reviews.author: Sara Michelle Fetters

reviews.text: Queen's stunning, 20-minute performance at 1985's star-studded "Live Aid" charity concert seems perfectly re-created, too, in helping bring down the curtain on a film that might actually really rock you.
reviews.author: John Urbancich

reviews.text: Rami Malek lives up to Freddie Mercury's lavish and over-the-top persona as he belts out one hit song after another in a tribute worthy of Queen's status among rock legends.
reviews.author: Matt Rodriguez

reviews.text: Sinuous Rami Malek's magnificent performance should be high on the list for an Oscar nomination.
reviews.author: Susan Granger

reviews.text: The film suffers from the utterly poor direction of Bryan Singer.
reviews.author: Ben Rolph

reviews.text: The movie's saving grace is its leading man, Rami Malek, and his blistering recreation of Mercury's on-stage performances, both of which capture our memories of Queen with comforting fidelity.
reviews.author: Ed Whitfield

reviews.text: Rami Malek and the entire cast performances are pitch perfect. And then there is the power of the music! This is must see moviemaking at its best.
reviews.author: Jackie K. Cooper

reviews.text: [Malek] is endlessly charismatic and somehow pulls off the physicality needed to approximate Mercury on stage.
reviews.author: Alan French

reviews.text: The music sequences in this drama (especially the Live Aid performance and the recording of the title song) are electrifying, and Malek is magnetic, but overall the movie is slavishly by-the-numbers.
reviews.author: Jeffrey M. Anderson

reviews.text: Is this the real life? Is this just fantasy? Judging by Anthony McCarten's screenplay, the biopic falls in the "fantasy" category. Facts are sacrificed for entertainment in Bryan Singer's crowd pleaser which features an electrifying Rami Malek.
reviews.author: Joe Friar

reviews.text: Rami Malek's extraordinary performance and the recreation of Queen's Live Aid performance are more than worth the price of admission.
reviews.author: Juanma Fernández París

reviews.text: Ideally, a film like this would attempt to add to, or to contextualize, a legacy. Instead, "Bohemian Rhapsody" tries to sanctify it, pack it in bubble wrap to protect it from causing, or being caught in, any friction.
reviews.author: Erin Keane

reviews.text: About as by the numbers and monotonous as you can expect from an end of the year musical biopic with Oscar aspirations.
reviews.author: Felix Vasquez Jr.

reviews.text: If you can accept that the film is going to cherry-pick certain moments from the band's career and omit others, you'll get a perfectly-entertaining, if not especially original rock biopic.
reviews.author: Mike McGranaghan

reviews.text: Rami Malek takes over the role of Freddie Mercury without really imitating or seeming like a copy lacking personality. [Full Review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Sergio López Aguirre

reviews.text: You might walk out of Bohemian Rhapsody with a smile, but it sells short as a biography, an exploration of their creative process or the interpretation of Mercury himself. [Full Review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Hugo Hernández Valdivia

reviews.text: Rami Malek blew me away.
reviews.author: Steph Cozza

reviews.text: Malek is so stellar in his portrayal and the music is just so good that I found myself completely entertained from start to finish. (Full Content Review for Parents - Profanity, Sexual Content, etc. - also Available)
reviews.author: Jim Judy

reviews.text: So in too many aspects the journey does not go beyond the superficial and judgmental, culminating in a long final sequence that is configured as the paradigm of the film for fans. [Full Review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Javier Ocaña

reviews.text: The biopic treatment is not the equal of its subject, but it is still a well-made and loving tribute that will send you scurrying to dig out your old Queen LPs, to remember what all the fuss was about.
reviews.author: Chris Knight

reviews.text: A weirdly punishing portrait of Freddie Mercury.
reviews.author: Sarah Marrs

reviews.text: [Any]drawbacks will be forgotten once Mercury takes the stage at Wembley and delivers an electrifying performance. "Bohemian Rhapsody" redeems itself by letting the music speak volumes. And Malek's show-stopping concert performance makes the film sing.
reviews.author: Gary M. Kramer

reviews.text: As a backstage story, Bohemian Rhapsody doesn't live up to its bohemian, post-glam-rock promise.
reviews.author: Armond White

reviews.text: If you are a Queen fan, the music is there and provides entertainment but at 135 minutes, the razzle dazzle wears thin and feels stretched.
reviews.author: Matthew Passantino

reviews.text: The problem is, inevitably the songs end. And when they do, you might wish you'd just put on a record instead.
reviews.author: Jeva Lange

reviews.text: This powerful Rhapsody, 10 years in the making, is really more Queen than Freddie -- a spectacle of joyful and electrifying rock 'n' roll.
reviews.author: Barry Paris

reviews.text: This movie is about heart and writer/director Bryan Singer opts not to shine a light on any cracks in the veneer.
reviews.author: Sarah Gopaul

reviews.text: The film only plays like a summary of Freddie's life, a bullet-point presentation of key moments, without angles or attitude, without ambition or even style.
reviews.author: Kong Rithdee

reviews.text: This is the karaoke version of Queen. All the notes are there, but not the soul.
reviews.author: Eli Glasner

reviews.text: The film is surprisingly smooth. Too smooth. The way Freddie Mercury lived his life, he deserved a movie guaranteed to blow our minds. Think, say, director Ken Russell at his balls-out, gaga peak. PG-13 just won't cut it.
reviews.author: Stephen Rebello

reviews.text: So much here is unconvincing: the 1970s are too clean; some of the studio scenes feel fake despite approval by the real Brian and Roger; and Malek at times nearly gags on his fake chompers.
reviews.author: David 'Mad Dog' Bradley

reviews.text: With such a cultural purview, who's to say that Bohemian Rhapsody - which aspires to little beyond simply entertaining its audience in the most generalist way - isn't successful?
reviews.author: Luke Goodsell

reviews.text: I can't remember the last time I have been so gripped by an actor's performance, from the first frame to the last.
reviews.author: Stephen Romei

reviews.text: While in many ways the stylish film lacks the ambition of its subjects, it's quite a showcase for the music, first and foremost, which pushes boundaries and combines genres.
reviews.author: Todd Jorgenson

reviews.text: We're supposed to settle again, this time with the sanitized, mean-spirited, gay-shaming, and altogether lame biopic of Freddie Mercury...Bohemian Rhapsody is that disappointing.
reviews.author: Kevin Fallon

reviews.text: The film still doesn't quite know how to capture or contain that energy, so it all just sort of goes splat on-screen. It's haphazard, and it somehow just barely works.
reviews.author: K. Austin Collins

reviews.text: Rami Malek's incredible turn as Freddie Mercury singlehandedly saves this too-by-the numbers musical biopic. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Fico Cangiano

reviews.text: The truth is that only Rami Malek stands out, although totally delivers, making an impression with every gesture and penetrating look. [Full Review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Emmanuel Báez

reviews.text: It's basically Walk Hard without the parody or the jokes. It takes a particular set of balls to non-ironically string together the same exact formula more than ten years after Jake Kasdan's underrated comedy classic skewered it.
reviews.author: Oktay Ege Kozak

reviews.text: Good music and the relationships with the band were my standouts.
reviews.author: Tony Baker

reviews.text: It's a film for fans, and for those who want to know more about the band and what it meant. [Full Review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Pablo O. Scholz

reviews.text: Freddie Mercury deserves better.
reviews.author: Carly Lewis

reviews.text: It's meticulously staged on a grand and exhilarating scale and the figure of Malek, strutting and capering before that swaying, chanting mass of humanity seems to embody all rock stars in both their vanity and their courage.
reviews.author: Sandra Hall

reviews.text: On the one hand, we've got a muddied, even tame dramatic story. On the other hand, we've got sheer glory in the creativity and performance of Queen...Glory wins out.
reviews.author: Abbie Bernstein

reviews.text: Bohemian Rhapsody is polite to the point of quailing, a deeply inoffensive and bland film about the life of one of the most wilfully offensive and interesting figures in the rock pantheon.
reviews.author: Walter Chaw

reviews.text: A gift to Queen fans. Rami Malek is astonishing as Freddie Mercury. Live Aid ending is enormous high.
reviews.author: James Verniere

reviews.text: Some of the liberties do Mercury and Queen an injustice, but most are harmless (if dim). A hundred small things wrong barely matter when there are one or two big things right.
reviews.author: David Edelstein

reviews.text: It takes a certain degree of, um, talent to make a crashingly dull movie about Freddie Mercury, one of the least drab humans who ever lived.
reviews.author: Alissa Wilkinson

reviews.text: The biggest failing of the movie is that it works too hard to be a movie, and not nearly hard enough at telling the tragic story of Mercury and the glory of Queen.
reviews.author: Chuck Yarborough

reviews.text: BOHEMIAN RHAPSODY is THE cinematic experience of the year! A fully sensory explosion of movies and music and mastery. Rami Malek is transcendent and beyond Oscar-worthy. And if an Oscar were to be given for casting, hand it to Susie Figgis now.
reviews.author: Debbie Lynn Elias

reviews.text: This was a legit, good peek behind the curtain of the life of a very influential artist... If for nothing else, watch it just to watch Rami Malek's performance.
reviews.author: Jeremy Jahns

reviews.text: Bizarrely, the film plays out almost the entire set as a kind of filler, while also trying to cram in enough emotional resonance to fulfill an audience's expectation for sweet-laced closure.
reviews.author: Piers Marchant

reviews.text: The film gets out of the way of Malek's performance, but it never gives him anything back. It's a film and a performance obsessed with iconography and appearance and an overall work that doesn't care in the slightest about personality or empathy.
reviews.author: Andrew Parker

reviews.text: It's cautious and inoffensive. And that's exactly why it's so disappointing. The Freddie Mercury biopic is the antithesis of its subject's abundant energy, his fearless artistry.
reviews.author: Adam Epstein

reviews.text: The kind of show-the-work exhausting 'meticulously-detailed imitation of a famous dead person's widely-remembered mannerisms' performance that's been known to induce priapic erections in Academy Awards voters.
reviews.author: Bob Chipman

reviews.text: Bohemian Rhapsody is determined to remain an upbeat crowd-pleaser throughout, despite what history tells us.
reviews.author: James Marsh

reviews.text: Bohemian Rhapsody may not be a great film (and I have no idea how accurate it is) but it's definitely entertaining. This is a celebration of the music Queen created and the man whose voice and presence will never be forgotten.
reviews.author: Leonard Maltin

reviews.text: Mercury turns in the performance of his young career, channeling Mercury's flamboyance, charisma and showmanship.
reviews.author: Phil Villarreal

reviews.text: In short, this is a Queen biopic for people who like their music biz stories tame, easily digestible and, in the sexuality spectrum, at least 75 percent straight.
reviews.author: Rubén Rosario

reviews.text: "Bohemian Rhapsody" is most enjoyable during its grand concert scenes where Malek does an uncanny job capturing the style and mannerisms of the great vocalist. The raw energy, burning charisma and general likeability of Mercury come across brilliantly.
reviews.author: Alci Rengifo

reviews.text: Bohemian Rhapsody may not totally rock you, but Rami Malek channels the thrilling, show-stopping charisma of the late Queen super singer, ensuring this inappropriately timid biopic is as entertaining as it can possibly be.
reviews.author: Luke Parker

reviews.text: Embrace the vintage silliness. It's worth it.
reviews.author: Kurt Loder

reviews.text: Rami Malek, drenched with charisma and sex appeal embodied Freddie Mercury in Bohemian Rhapsody. He didn't portray him nor imitate him. He was him.
reviews.author: Jamie Broadnax

reviews.text: Here's how Rami Malek crushes the film's by-the-numbers plotting and vapid first act.
reviews.author: Christian Toto

reviews.text: ...concludes with a final sequence that is absolutely transcendent and will make you forget about the sometimes pedestrian material that preceded it.
reviews.author: Sarah Boslaugh

reviews.text: "Bohemian Rhapsody" never has a mundane moment. Sparked by the performance by Malek and the amazing music of Queen, this movie generates a massive amount of creative energy.
reviews.author: Rick Bentley

reviews.text: More like Bohemian Parody.
reviews.author: Harris Dang

reviews.text: Has a dutiful, respectable air about it.
reviews.author: Robert Horton

reviews.text: It's not real. It's not honest. It lacks the magic to live forever.
reviews.author: Douglas Davidson

reviews.text: Wearing its PG-13 rating proudly, this soft biopic is aimed directly at a younger generation that discovered the chart-topping music in high school chorus class.
reviews.author: Jonathan W. Hickman

reviews.text: "Bohemian Rhapsody" is a just-good movie with a great performance...In other words, it is entertaining, if not illuminating.
reviews.author: Nell Minow

reviews.text: The biopic reaches out for the very last row, and in doing so, it becomes unfortunately basic, flattening out the fascinating character while sanding down and rearranging elements of the story to serve the band.
reviews.author: Katie Walsh

reviews.text: Bohemian Rhapsody delivers a paint by numbers but nonetheless captivating and even emotionally uplifting rendition of Queen's and Freddie Mercury's trajectory, with a stunning turn by Rami Malek
reviews.author: J. Don Birnam

reviews.text: The film is so much fun yet so moving it doesn't matter if the story is not 100% accurate and doesn't truly and completely document the band's meteoric rise to fame. It rocks!
reviews.author: Lisa Johnson Mandell

reviews.text: The problem with all this meticulous recreation is that, in the end, it rings hollow.
reviews.author: James Berardinelli

reviews.text: While historical accuracy is not the first priority, the point of the story is sacrifice: the artist on a cross. That may seem a bit grandiose, but grandiosity was always the fuel source of Queen and Freddie Mercury-and of Bohemian Rhapsody as well.
reviews.author: John Anderson

reviews.text: I went into the theater hoping for the best, and I got it. While not a concert film, the engaging portrayal of the band's creative process repeatedly leads to electric performances of their songs.
reviews.author: Edward Johnson-Ott

reviews.text: There's nothing interesting or exciting about this portrayal of Freddie Mercury. He's a bystander in his own life, flitting from moment to moment until the movie dials up another Queen performance.
reviews.author: Steve Katz

reviews.text: The film is a decidedly mixed bag, feeling thoroughly confused, but ultimately it manages to honor Mercury's talent.
reviews.author: Steve Erickson

reviews.text: Meaning that as a Mercury biopic it might be questionable, but as an extended-play music video of Queen's music it's irresistible...
reviews.author: Carrie Rickey

reviews.text: Crackles with snappy dialogue, rarely plods and finds the characters' voices with little problem. If any issue exists it's courtesy of a film that lacks a plot.
reviews.author: George M. Thomas

reviews.text: Glorifying and sanitizing.
reviews.author: Tim Appelo

reviews.text: Despite its formulaic waltz - precipitous fame, internal fracturing, drugs, tardiness, reconciliation - the film hums along with a fantastic sense of energy.
reviews.author: Matt Oakes

reviews.text: Bohemian Rhapsody provides casual fans with some raucous concert re-enactments, but those seeking insight into the band's and particularly Mercury's history should look elsewhere.
reviews.author: J.R. Kinnard

reviews.text: It asks the question of whether or not watching this movie is any better or worse than watching a good tribute band.
reviews.author: Hannah Lynn

reviews.text: The final product may shortchange both sides of its equation, but fans will probably still enjoy what Singer put on the screen. As a musical biopic, "Bohemian Rhapsody" is ultimately more interested in the greatest hits than mining deep cuts.
reviews.author: Josh Terry

reviews.text: Generally, the film feels like it is authentic.
reviews.author: Kirk Baird

reviews.text: By the skin of his prosthetic teeth, however, Malek just manages to drag Bohemian Rhapsody into competence.
reviews.author: Sean Collier

reviews.text: While "Bohemian Rhapsody" soars at covering the band's talent as songwriters, musicians and onstage performers, it fails to explain the source of Mercury's lyrical gifts, his ostentatious personality and gargantuan self-confidence and self-centeredness.
reviews.author: Bob Bloom

reviews.text: Buoyed by the infectious Queen soundtrack and Rami Malek's killer performance, 'Bohemian Rhapsody' will rock you.
reviews.author: Roger Tennis

reviews.text: A standard musical biopic with all the conventions in place... Still, the music is electrifying, and Malek is a stellar presence, as is Lucy Boynton as Mary Austin.
reviews.author: Jim Lane

reviews.text: If a film this crummy had been perpetrated on most ordinary rock stars, that would be bad enough but to present the life of someone as bold and iconoclastic as Mercury in such a formulaic manner almost feels like an insult.
reviews.author: Peter Sobczynski

reviews.text: To think about how much is missing from Bohemian Rhapsody hurts, not simply because it doesn't paint a full picture of the man we know as Freddie Mercury, but because it paints something that doesn't feel honest.
reviews.author: Juan Barquin

reviews.text: The only thing that's surprising about this film is the endeavor to turning it into one more post-mortem marketing product. [Full Review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Luis Martínez

reviews.text: [Malek creates] a soulful impression of the late great rock star, successfully channelling Mercury's sinuous stage persona in a series of charismatic concert performances underpinned by Queen's rousing back catalogue.
reviews.author: Vicky Roach

reviews.text: Oh, what I wouldn't give for a little of that sense of danger, that reckless abandon in service to the beat, anywhere during the 135 minutes of "Bohemian Rhapsody."
reviews.author: Sean P. Means

reviews.text: Taken strictly on its terms, Bohemian Rhapsody is a credible exercise in nostalgia, if not an especially inspired one.
reviews.author: Brian Lowry

reviews.text: Malek has the ineffable pixie dust the part requires (if not the teeth; the famous Freddie overbite is prosthetic).
reviews.author: Leah Greenblatt

reviews.text: Queen enthusiasts will probably choke on some of the egregious sins against chronology and raw facts committed to cram the real story into the format. However, where the script succeeds is in the most complicated part of Mercury: his approach to love.
reviews.author: Richard Whittaker

reviews.text: "Rhapsody" Missing a Few Vital Notes.
reviews.author: Charles Koplinski

reviews.text: When all was said and done, Queen just wanted to have fun. Which is why I'm inclined to cut much slack for Singer's approach, which follows a Rock 101 storytelling template: Levis to leather pants, superstardom to squabbles, leave-taking to Live Aid.
reviews.author: Peter Howell

reviews.text: Between Malek and the incredible music, the film gets the job done-but just barely.
reviews.author: Max Weiss

reviews.text: If you love great rock music presented with dynamic flair, this is one movie that will make you want to wax rhapsodically. Well worth the money for anyone who loves great rock and roll, it's like having a concert and a movie rolled into one.
reviews.author: Carl Kozlowski

reviews.text: The film's finale is a recreation of Queen's iconic Live Aid set, with Malek performing a move-for-move re-enactment, not missing a beat. Three decades later, it still will rock you.
reviews.author: Dana Barbuto

reviews.text: Proves the task of trying to define Queen may be impossible.
reviews.author: Cameron Williams

reviews.text: Nothing more than a conventional, old fashioned musical biography, but one done up with such verve and technical proficiency that it's engaging from beginning to end.
reviews.author: Frank Swietek

reviews.text: Even as a celebration of Queen's music, Rhapsody is superficial and unconvincing, functioning only as a collection of mediocre music videos.
reviews.author: Josh Bell

reviews.text: You'll leave grinning and humming Queen anthems for days to come.
reviews.author: Ross Raihala

reviews.text: By rights, this ought to be a glammed-up, sexually-charged, four-octave blowout. Instead, it's a stilted, stagy, hopelessly corny biopic, the kind of thing "Walk Hard" was meant to prevent.
reviews.author: Rafer Guzman

reviews.text: The trouble isn't really star Rami Malek, who gives a mesmerizing if opaque performance as Mercury. The problem is that the movie doesn't have anything interesting to say.
reviews.author: Ty Burr

reviews.text: What could be a strutting, fabulous testament to the glamour of Queen's arena-rock showboating is instead hamstrung with the need to explain, and then underline that explanation, and then circle it...
reviews.author: Glen Weldon

reviews.text: An entertaining movie that sometimes chastise Mercury more than honor him but gets upped by Malik's almost mystical performance (Full Spanish review in link)
reviews.author: Jorge Rivera Rubio

reviews.text: [Malek] burns up the screen as Mercury whether dealing with intimate personal issues, ego-driven conflicts behind the scenes, or on stage in performance.
reviews.author: Daniel M. Kimmel

reviews.text: Bohemian Rhapsody fulfils its checklist as a Queen biopic, delivering a feel-good movie that hits all the expected notes without particularly innovating otherwise.
reviews.author: Jennifer Heaton

reviews.text: The film is the cinematic equivalent of a rudimentarily assembled greatest-hits compilation when we instead needed a collection of deep album cuts. Nevertheless, Rhapsody will rock you.
reviews.author: Cameron Meier

reviews.text: Queen made great albums; Bohemian Rhapsody is just a playlist.
reviews.author: David Bax

reviews.text: Bohemian Rhapsody may get us to raise our voices and sing, but it won't make us raise our eyebrows in piqued interest beyond the music.
reviews.author: Don Shanahan

reviews.text: Save for the music, there's nothing authentic about it.
reviews.author: Mark Dujsik

reviews.text: This movie is nothing but shortcuts... It's movie karaoke.
reviews.author: Martin Thomas

reviews.text: It feels phony... They took a larger-than-life band... and put them in a biopic that is painfully typical.
reviews.author: Korey Coleman

reviews.text: But, the film works. And I reckon that's down - mostly - to the absolutely astonishing performance by Rami Malek as Mercury.
reviews.author: Graeme Tuckett

reviews.text: Fortunately, Malek, working with a script that is more a series of standard tropes than compelling story, presents the right mix of outrageous ego, savage wit, languid ennui, & vulnerable insecurity that makes him empathetic even Mercury is being a jerk.
reviews.author: Andrea Chase

reviews.text: Great movies often have great performances, but I think it must be harder for an actor to give a great performance in the midst of a bad movie. You see where I'm going with this, don't you?
reviews.author: Kristian M. Lin

reviews.text: Contradictions. All I know for sure is that Queen was a magnificent band, Freddie Mercury had an incredible voice, and Radio Ga Ga is still a banger. I knew those things going into Bohemian Rhapsody, but it was nice to see it confirmed.
reviews.author: Norman Wilner

reviews.text: So I enjoyed the film, even as I wished for more from the director, Bryan Singer, than lackluster cinematic and thematic choices.
reviews.author: Kyle Smith

reviews.text: As turbulent as Mercury's wild life is the production of the biographical drama Bohemian Rhapsody, a tribute to the whole group, but with a clear focus on its dazzling leader. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Ruben Peralta Rigaud

reviews.text: Rami Malek will rock you! [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Irene Crespo

reviews.text: Bohemian Rhapsody doesn't suck. There's a soul inside it, and some anguish, too.
reviews.author: Stephanie Zacharek

reviews.text: Highlighted by wonderful music and performances, Rami Malek looks like Freddie Mercury, walks like him, and performs like him.
reviews.author: Tony Medley

reviews.text: Yes, it's entertaining, even euphoric in parts but as a deep dive into the rock icon's life this biopic is disappointingly safe.
reviews.author: Toby Woollaston

reviews.text: While a touch too vanilla and very sanitized, BOHEMIAN RHAPSODY works the way it was intended, as a celebration of the band and its music.
reviews.author: Chris Bumbray

reviews.text: In struggling to make a salable PG-13 movie out of an R-rated rock life, this Queen biopic stumbles. But there's only praise to heap on Rami Malek whose tour de force performance as Freddie Mercury will definitely rock you.
reviews.author: Peter Travers

reviews.text: The story is strong, that acting is fantastic and, well, you can't beat the hit songs... Bohemian Rhapsody is a must-see classic-rock movie masterpiece.
reviews.author: Michael Heaton

reviews.text: Pretty much everyone in this film is a cipher, particularly Mercury's bandmates.
reviews.author: Moira MacDonald

reviews.text: An exuberant celebration of not just Freddie Mercury, but the band Queen and the volatile nature of creativity.
reviews.author: Christopher Lloyd

reviews.text: For a man and a band that were so groundbreaking, so fixated on musical revolution, this is supremely cheap work.
reviews.author: Cameron Frew

reviews.text: With actor Rami Malek transforming into a larger-than-life legend like Freddie Mercury and delivering the best performance of his young career - and an Oscar-worthy one at that - he keeps the film from going completely out of tune.
reviews.author: Kiko Martinez

reviews.text: Care is taken to coat everything with a layer of light, self-deprecating comedy. It is as if Mercury or May are on the couch, regaling a talk-show audience with an anecdote.
reviews.author: John Lui

reviews.text: This isn't the deep dive Behind the Music look at Queen, but it's got enough going in its favor to be a winner, if not the champion of musical biopics.
reviews.author: Jeffrey Lyles

reviews.text: "Bohemian Rhapsody" winds up being giddily entertaining, first as an exercise in so-bad-it's-funny kitsch, and ultimately as something far more meaningful and thrilling.
reviews.author: Ann Hornaday

reviews.text: Bohemian Rhapsody is the fast food of music biopics. It looks delicious in its advertisements, but is ultimately tasteless and leaves you with nothing but dissatisfaction.
reviews.author: Rendy Jones

reviews.text: Most of the non-music segments feel contrived and soap-like. There is barely a believable conversation in the entire film.
reviews.author: Jonathan Roberts

reviews.text: The music is great, but the biographical elements come off as a deeply puritan "Partying and gay sex are bad, mkay?" afterschool special.
reviews.author: Scott Mendelson

reviews.text: On the spectrum of Queen, this is no "Bohemian Rhapsody" masterpiece, but it's not quite "I'm In Love With My Car."
reviews.author: Tom Santilli

reviews.text: Rami Malek brings warmth, humor, and a down-to-earth humanity to the larger-than-life Freddie Mercury. But it is the power of Queen's music - the rousing good cheer, its sheer rock 'n' roll joy - that fills up this pure brash entertainment.
reviews.author: MaryAnn Johanson

reviews.text: Bohemian Rhapsody might be easy come, easy go, but Malek makes for a show-stopping silhouetto of a man.
reviews.author: Jake Coyle

reviews.text: The swift yet lengthy Bohemian Rhapsody often verges on becoming something as thrilling as Queen itself - and then crashes back into the off-putting, the ill-considered or the ridiculous.
reviews.author: Alan Scherstuhl

reviews.text: Bohemian Rhapsody is bad in the way a lot of biopics are bad: it's superficial, it avoids complexity, and the narrative has a connect-the-dots quality.
reviews.author: Sheila O'Malley

reviews.text: It's flawed but Bohemian Rhapsody still manages to be gripping, mostly because of Rami Malek, whose performance as Freddie Mercury is towering.
reviews.author: Kim Hughes

reviews.text: "Bohemian Rhapsody" does deliver what any music biopic must: convincing characters and some kick-butt simulated concert experiences.
reviews.author: Kerry Lengel

reviews.text: A baroque blend of gibberish, mysticism and melodrama, the film seems engineered to be as unmemorable as possible, with the exception of the prosthetic teeth worn by the lead actor, Rami Malek, who plays Freddie Mercury, Queen's lead singer.
reviews.author: A.O. Scott

reviews.text: there is no denying the magnetism of Rami Malek's performance. You cannot take your eyes off him. But the film he inhabits...is mostly a paint-by-the-numbers affair, hopscotching from one important event to the next with little pause for reflection.
reviews.author: Laura Clifford

reviews.text: Malek's remarkable, spellbinding performance almost makes you forget you're really watching a quasi-Queen with a faux Freddie.
reviews.author: Neil Pond

reviews.text: Why'd anyone want to watch them do the Lip Sync Challenge after two long hours, when we just wanna get out, just wanna get right outta here?
reviews.author: Simon Miraudo

reviews.text: The movie is both flimsy and wholly enjoyable at the same time, in the strange manner of biopics, which follow in the jet stream of someone else's artistry while caring little for their own clunky, cuboid dimensions.
reviews.author: Tom Shone

reviews.text: [A] sprawling, jumbled and disappointingly airbrushed new movie about the legendary rock band and especially its incandescent frontman, Freddie Mercury (Rami Malek).
reviews.author: Justin Chang

reviews.text: Bohemian Rhapsody isn't quite killer Queen but it's enjoyably close. Despite the teeth.
reviews.author: Matthew Bond

reviews.text: Dazzlingly captures an era, a man and the universal quest for identity.
reviews.author: Frank Lovece

reviews.text: Bohemian Rhapsody loses itself in the attempt to avoid the controversial issues in Mercury's life, leaving us with only his stage figure, but that is well worth it and if you are not very demanding, it will not disappoint. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Laura Hiros

reviews.text: Rami Malek shines as the frontman, giving a portrayal of an, ahem, mercurial lead singer, giving light to a fairly straightforward story.
reviews.author: Aine O'Connor

reviews.text: Malek handles a pair of dentures and Freddie's oddly plummy speaking voice with aplomb, and captures the cheeky, charming, outrageous persona with which Mercury both confronted the world and protected himself from it.
reviews.author: Paul Whitington

reviews.text: Oh! my great aunt Ada, what an anodyne cop-out to reduce a man of infinite flamboyance and indulgence to the almost mundane.
reviews.author: Matthew Norman

reviews.text: Most of the film is stuffed with lumps of cheesy rock-speak ("We're just not thinking big enough"; "I won't compromise my vision"), and gives off the delicious aroma of parody.
reviews.author: Anthony Lane

reviews.text: Rami Malek is terrific playing Queen frontman Freddie Mercury, that's for sure, but the movie itself falls short of the intended mark. It simply has very little to say about its subject.
reviews.author: Joey Magidson

reviews.text: This isn't a documentary, rather reality reimagined as a highly entertaining, bombastic fairy tale.
reviews.author: Adam Fresco

reviews.text: Singer's film sure could have used more rhapsody because whenever Freddie and the band focus on the music, 'Bohemian Rhapsody' truly sings.
reviews.author: Jordan Ruimy

reviews.text: A breathtaking performance... the eerie and exemplary portrayal by Malik ... an inspiration for accepting family (biological or tribal) regardless of its flaws. Freddie is missed and was loved, but the show must go on.
reviews.author: Kevin A. Ranson

reviews.text: Malek's sublime performance and the smashing soundtrack of Queen's greatest hits are ultimately masking a generic, by-the-numbers film that consistently plays it far too safe.
reviews.author: Doug Jamieson

reviews.text: It's hard to come up with someone who would have been better than Malek. To his credit, he does the one thing that would most seem impossible: In the stage scenes, he makes you believe he's Freddie Mercury.
reviews.author: Mick LaSalle

reviews.text: Fans of the band might enjoy watching the movie cycle through their hits (and there are many), but those, like me, hoping for a more robust appraisal of the late Freddie Mercury may find themselves disappointed.
reviews.author: Simran Hans

reviews.text: And yet, for all its faults, there's enough going on in Bohemian Rhapsody that grabs the attention. This mostly falls at the feet of Rami Malek, who goes above and beyond.
reviews.author: Ross Miller

reviews.text: Not quite guaranteed to blow your mind. However, it does have emotional heft and that extended Live Aid scene is worth it alone.
reviews.author: Alan Corr

reviews.text: Malek is electrifying in the role, and in the end Bohemian Rhapsody celebrates Queen's oeuvre and, in moments both intimate and entertaining, its creation.
reviews.author: Annlee Ellingson

reviews.text: It delivered. I love this. Probably one of my favorite movies of the year, thus far.
reviews.author: Kristian Harloff

reviews.text: They don't get below the skin, per say, but it's a hell of a ride watching it...one of the more impressive performances I've seen on celluloid.
reviews.author: Mark Ellis

reviews.text: The scenes with the band in the studio are among the film's finest. There are some gloriously Spinal Tap moments, particularly during the recording of the title song.
reviews.author: Alison Rowat

reviews.text: No matter your age, race, sexual orientation, you name it, when you're singing along with more than 70,000 people, you're all on the same level sharing the same passion, and celebrating music and life that way for a moment in this movie felt special.
reviews.author: Perri Nemiroff

reviews.text: It does work.
reviews.author: Joshua Starnes

reviews.text: It's polished, inauthentic, sanitised, and plays like a 130-minute trailer.
reviews.author: Owen Richards

reviews.text: Bohemian Rhapsody attempts to work through this moral conundrum for Queen's pious fans. And I hope they enjoy it, because I think they're the only fans who can.
reviews.author: Chase Burns

reviews.text: Malek is forced to carry this film, and much of his performance is flamboyance and kitsch masquerading as personality.
reviews.author: Kristen Lopez

reviews.text: It's a film that carries on (carries on), but ultimately doesn't really matter.
reviews.author: Mike Reyes

reviews.text: Despite a strong performance by Malek, Bohemian Rhapsody plays out as an excessively sanitized version of Queen's story, rather than a labor of love.
reviews.author: Sandy Schaefer

reviews.text: A pricey, showy presentation can't make up for a bargain story in Bohemian Rhapsody.
reviews.author: Blake Goble

reviews.text: ...it is not necessary to like Queen's music in order to find this film watchable and mildly enjoyable.
reviews.author: Mark Demetrius

reviews.text: The movie is at its best when the focus is on the music ...
reviews.author: Greg Maki

reviews.text: Rami Malek's all-encompassing performance vibrantly steals every scene he inhabits. It's an excellent portrayal of an excellent musician. A flawed movie surrounds him but his captivating acting and bustling persona smooth out the rough spots.
reviews.author: Clayton Davis

reviews.text: The volatile stream of Mercury running through it holds our interest. His otherworldliness, his peacock preening and his cocky sexuality all come from tangled roots.
reviews.author: Kate Muir

reviews.text: The tears I shed in the cinema were for the glorious exhilaration of it all. Freddie shed his tears in private for his own demons and unimaginable pain - and perhaps that is the way it should stay.
reviews.author: Stefan Kyriazis

reviews.text: Rami Malek delivers an unforgettable performance in a breakout role destined to be remembered come awards season.
reviews.author: Kam Williams

reviews.text: Bohemian Rhapsody desperately wants the accolade of being a greatest hits album, and ends up playing more like a one hit wonder.
reviews.author: Nate Adams

reviews.text: The cartoon unreality of Bohemian Rhapsody will feel, to many fans, like being trapped in a Queen nightmare.
reviews.author: Kate Mossman

reviews.text: The costumes and wigs are splendid, and the songs are still up to snuff. But this homage to a showman is more famine than feast.
reviews.author: Jasper Rees

reviews.text: While the film is definitely entertaining because of extensive use of the group's greatest hits and Ramek's lively performance, the rest is as substantive as one of the band's concert anthems.
reviews.author: Travis Hopson

reviews.text: Appropriately for a group known for its theatrical, crowd-pleasing tunes, this biopic carries itself lightly, serving up familiar plot points with panache and a sense of humor.
reviews.author: Tim Grierson

reviews.text: The production has taken 15 years of pure theatrical energy and made a slog of a movie.
reviews.author: Brian Orndorf

reviews.text: Full of the music you will fondly remember and featuring one of the most immersive performances by an actor EVER, "Bohemian Rhapsody" is a musical masterpiece.
reviews.author: Michael A. Smith

reviews.text: A dramatisation about the making of Bohemian Rhapsody might have resulted in a much better film than what we've been given.
reviews.author: Terry Staunton

reviews.text: The broad and larky tone suits the early days of wide-eyed tours and Top of the Pops. But as the script frantically scrolls through the band's Wikipedia page, the cast rarely have the chance for more than mimicry.
reviews.author: Danny Leigh

reviews.text: Malek is magnetic...
reviews.author: Rich Cline

reviews.text: Bohemian Rhapsody is a rollicking, high energy tribute. Rami Malek is the embodiment of Freddie Mercury. He carries Bohemian Rhapsody from the first frame to the last.
reviews.author: Julian Roman

reviews.text: Bohemian Rhapsody, an eight-year abomination in the making...cannot claim to have achieved even wiki-movie status.
reviews.author: Kevin Maher

reviews.text: Bohemian Rhapsody is fun but entirely superficial, playing it safe rather than trying to be as bold or brazen as its larger-than-life subject.
reviews.author: Jim Vejvoda

reviews.text: The film just about deserves the review that was given to the group's most memorable single, and which is quoted halfway through: it's "perfectly adequate".
reviews.author: Nicholas Barber

reviews.text: The music of Queen will live forever, but this fan hopes the tonedeaf and overpriced tat will not.
reviews.author: Ella Kemp

reviews.text: Toothless mass-market pop revisionism which is no where near as cool or compelling as its subject.
reviews.author: Hannah Strong

reviews.text: A loud but disappointingly tame account that follows a generic by the numbers screenplay...
reviews.author: Katherine McLaughlin

reviews.text: Queen fans will most definitely find a great deal of enjoyment, but it's the diehards and film aficionados that will come away feeling cheated out of an amazing and truthful biopic
reviews.author: Robert Kojder

reviews.text: Bohemian Rhapsody has some major issues in telling the true story.
reviews.author: Danielle Solzman

reviews.text: Bohemian Rhapsody is... a "[rotten] sort of cheese waiting on the shelf."
reviews.author: Robert Daniels

reviews.text: You don't see actors acting, but four band members working together on their music and building their careers.
reviews.author: Scott Menzel

reviews.text: Rami Malek as Freddie Mercury gives a transformative performance.
reviews.author: Ashley Menzel

reviews.text: If, indeed, the intent of this bio-pic is to chronicle the events that led to Queen and Freddie Mercury's legendary performance at Live Aid, well, I guess the goal has been met. The movie, as it is, is fine. But it could have been so much more.
reviews.author: Joanna Langfield

reviews.text: "Bohemian Rhapsody" the song is a sonic masterpiece and "Bohemian Rhapsody" the movie is just a conventional rock flick, one all too ordinary for a man and a band that exemplified the extraordinary.
reviews.author: Brian Truitt

reviews.text: I really can't say enough about Rami Malek ... He's why this movie works as well as it does.
reviews.author: Dan Murrell

reviews.text: [It] doesn't feel like a con job; rather, it's a genuine attempt to bring Queen and the legacy of Freddie Mercury to life on the big screen for the one thing that reigned supreme in their dynasty: the music. And what music it is.
reviews.author: Pete Hammond

reviews.text: It's a kind of magic any way you slice it.
reviews.author: Kyle Anderson

reviews.text: It is a wig-and-teeth movie, but Malek's performance really sells the entire performance.
reviews.author: Roth Cornet

reviews.text: In common with The Proclaimers film, this is very much a jukebox musical which rests entirely on the viewer's tolerance (or love) for Queen's music -- don't like the band; nothing to see here -- and Rami Malek's appropriately majestic performance.
reviews.author: Tara Brady

reviews.text: I enjoyed it, but this isn't much real life, it's more fantasy.
reviews.author: Jamie East

reviews.text: While flawed, much like the band's music, this is a film that is very easy to sit back and enjoy, even if you can appreciate that, at times, it's not particularly very good.
reviews.author: Stefan Pape

reviews.text: What we ultimately wanted from Bohemian Rhapsody was not carbon-copied concerts, but behind-closed-doors insight into a deeply private, complicated, internationally beloved superstar.
reviews.author: Johnny Oleksinski

reviews.text: Like a lot of depictions of rock music on film, Bohemian Rhapsody lacks both the stylistic daring of a music video and the outright euphoria of a proper musical, but it gets closer to both with the Live Aid sequence.
reviews.author: Jesse Hassenger

reviews.text: The critical failure of Bohemian Rhapsody is that, 134 minutes after the lights go down, the members of Queen just seem like four blokes who've been processed through the rusty machinery of a Hollywood biopic.
reviews.author: David Ehrlich

reviews.text: In hindsight, it would be better if this movie didn't exist at all.
reviews.author: Mike Ryan

reviews.text: A bolder film might have explored the relationship between Mercury's hedonism, his mostly closeted sexuality and his on and off-stage personas in a more nuanced way.
reviews.author: Steve Rose

reviews.text: Malek's Freddie is a musical performance for the ages, but the film he's trapped in is the three-minute radio edit that the character and real songwriter would have never settled for.
reviews.author: David Crow

reviews.text: Although Malek looks the part, and has Freddie's dance moves down, his performance is all stiff British accent and overbite.
reviews.author: Matt Singer

reviews.text: Despite its intentions to get close to Mercury, Bohemian Rhapsody is as intimate as a sold-out stadium show, with none of the accompanying power.
reviews.author: Kimber Myers

reviews.text: What's arrived at the other side of this troubled production history is a work that's all spirit, no soul.
reviews.author: Clarisse Loughrey

reviews.text: The songs are where the movie really gets its emotional core, and that alone is perhaps worth the ticket of admission.
reviews.author: Anne Cohen

reviews.text: Fortunately, the film comes to life any time that Queen take to the stage, thanks to dynamic staging and dedicated performances from all four stars.
reviews.author: Ian Sandwell

reviews.text: The film has a secret weapon: Rami Malek. As Mercury he is spectacular.
reviews.author: Olly Richards

reviews.text: This will rock you.
reviews.author: Chris Hunneysett

reviews.text: The final hurrah for Mercury's genius, this huge, hubristic spectacle lets you grant his troubled film a pass: at least it keeps on fighting to the end.
reviews.author: Tim Robey

reviews.text: An object example of how a film can be entertaining and even exhilarating without being particularly good, Bohemian Rhapsody has the driving energy of a stadium anthem and the fizzy meaninglessness of a bubblegum pop song.
reviews.author: Alonso Duralde

reviews.text: I'm happy to report that this is not Bohemian Crapsody.
reviews.author: Fred Topel

reviews.text: Frankly, if you are not cheering along with the crowd as Mercury belts out an ultra-satisfying rendition of "We are the Champions," then a doctor should check your pulse. Somewhere, an outrageous artist knows that his Queen movie rules.
reviews.author: Mara Reinstein

reviews.text: Bohemian Rhapsody might not be the be-all end-all story of Freddie Mercury and Queen ... but it's easily the next best thing.
reviews.author: Edward Douglas

reviews.text: With a performance as commanding as Rami Malek's at its center, why isn't Bohemian Rhapsody a better movie?
reviews.author: Owen Gleiberman

reviews.text: Larger-than-life performances energize a shallow highlight reel.
reviews.author: Russ Fischer

reviews.text: The energy of Malek's imitation helps to bind what amounts to a series of gossipy but harmless rock-world anecdotes into something vaguely coherent.
reviews.author: Dave Calhoun

reviews.text: Bohemian Rhapsody mistakenly believes that simply trudging through a workmanlike overview of Freddie Mercury's life will allow it to arrive at something approaching intimacy.
reviews.author: Richard Larson

reviews.text: While the foot-stomping jams and sweeping scope make this a theatrical experience, the filmmakers find few inventive nuances within the formulaic framework.
reviews.author: Courtney Howard

reviews.text: To the filmmakers' credit, and even though they don't entirely avoid the clunky factoid-itis that often plagues the genre, this is a biopic that favors sensory experience over exposition. It understands what pure, electrifying fun rock 'n' roll can be.
reviews.author: Sheri Linden

reviews.text: The film benefits from some uncanny performances that help it transcend all the dodgy wigs and telegraphed dialogue; and of course it has that majestic back catalogue to draw from whenever things start sagging.
reviews.author: Alistair Harkness

synopsis: Freddie Mercury -- the lead singer of Queen -- defies stereotypes and convention to become a beloved entertainer; the band's popular songs lead to Queen's rise in the 1970s; after leaving the group to pursue a solo career, Mercury reunites with Queen for the benefit concert Live Aid -- resulting in one of the most memorable performances in rock 'n' roll.
